channel.title: Remote desktop connections on Kubuntu
channel.description:
I have recently swatch over to *buntu linux. I had Ubuntu, but swatch to Kubuntu because i find KDE To be a much friendly looking interface.
Now, i need to connect to my [b]windows server 2003[/b] VPS. I try the remote dekstop client, i put in the ip, and the connect button never goes out of non clickable. I need it so i can see the desktop, like how i was on the windows, as i need to build my client from there so i can test Auto Cache Downloading and what not. I tried googling it, but i didnt get any help.

item.title: Remote desktop connections on Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

SERVERIP being replaced with the actual IP address of his server. But I agree, it sounds more like a server issue. It connects just doesn’t authenticate? Have you tried the standard windows remote desktop successfully?

Read full topic

item.title: Remote desktop connections on Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“SonGoku, post:3, topic:210885”]Okay, i tried that, and heres what happens.

I put

SERVERIP:3389 (3389 as its the default i think)
And it gets stuck at authenticating, so does that just take longer :S[/quote]3389 looks more like a port rather than an ip?

And is swatch a word? switched?

Read full topic

item.title: Remote desktop connections on Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

sounds like it is a problem from the server end…

Read full topic

item.title: Remote desktop connections on Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

I just use the remote desktop connection thing under internet in kubuntu, works fine when doing VNC, it also supports the Windows remote desktop thing as well.

Read full topic
